Pre-Game Insights: The Copa América final is set: Colombia will face Lionel Messi and Argentina, who will defend their championship title, on Sunday at the Hard Rock Stadium.

Dubbed 'the world’s oldest continental tournament,' Copa América has been underway in 14 venues across the U.S. this year, culminating in Miami Gardens with the top two teams in a final match on July 14th.
Looking ahead to the final on Sunday, July 14th, the two teams facing off against each other are Colombia and Argentina. The match is scheduled for 8 p.m.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Hard Rock Stadium is scheduled to host a total of three games, including two group stages and the final.
Tickets for the match are available for purchase on Ticketmaster, with prices starting at $1,500 and going as high as $9,000.
Shakira will perform at the Copa América closing ceremony, and her song 'Puntería' has been designated the official song for this year’s tournament.

The tournament will be broadcast on FOX Networks, including Fox Sports 1, Fox Sports 2, as well as the Fox Sports app. The matches will also be broadcast on Univision and TUDN with Spanish commentary.
